org.jmc
Class OBJFile

java.lang.Object
  org.jmc.OBJFile

public class OBJFile
extends java.lang.Object

OBJ file class. This file contains the geometry of the whole world we are trying to export. It also contains the links to the materials saved in the MTL file.

Author:
danijel

Nested Class Summary
private  class OBJFile.Face
          Small internal class for describing a simple rectangular face of an object.

          Small enum describing the mesh types.
static class OBJFile.TexCoordinate
          Small enum describing the UV location of the texture for simple rectangular textures.
private  class OBJFile.Vertex
          Small internal class for describing Vertices in a sortable fashion.

Field Detail

identifier

java.lang.String identifier
Identifier of the file. Since many OBJ class objects are created by different chunks, this helps differentiate them and assign them a name. It's usually just the coordinates of the chunk.

material

MTLFile material
Reference to the MTL file used in this OBJ.

vertices

java.util.List<OBJFile.Vertex> vertices
List of vertices in the file.

vertex_map

java.util.Map<OBJFile.Vertex,java.lang.Integer> vertex_map
Map of vertices to their respective IDs used in the faces of the mesh.

faces

java.util.List<OBJFile.Face> faces
List of faces in the file.

x_offset

float x_offset
Offsets of the file. Used to position the chunk in its right location.

y_offset

float y_offset
Offsets of the file. Used to position the chunk in its right location.

z_offset

float z_offset
Offsets of the file. Used to position the chunk in its right location.

setOffset

public void setOffset(int x,
                      int y,
                      int z)
Offset all the vertices by these amounts. Used to position the chunk in its right location.

Parameters:
x - x offset
y - y offset
z - z offset

addCube

public void addCube(float x,
                    float y,
                    float z,
                    int id,
                    boolean[] drawside)
Add a cube at the given location.

Parameters:
x - x coordinate
y - y coordinate
z - z coordinate
id - block id
drawside - 6-element array describing which sides are to be drawn

Append this object to the OBJ file.

Parameters:
out - writer of the OBJ file

printTexturesAndNormals

private void printTexturesAndNormals(java.io.PrintWriter out)
Write texture coordinates and normals. These are usually the same for all chunks.

Parameters:
out - writer of the OBJ file

sideToNormalIndex

private int sideToNormalIndex(MTLFile.Side side)
Converts the side to the normal index as printed by the printTexturesAndNormals method

Parameters:
side - side of the block
Returns:
index of the normal

addFace

private void addFace(OBJFile.Vertex[] verts,
                     MTLFile.Side side,
                     int id)
Add a face with the given vertices to the appropriate lists. Also create vertices if necessary.

Parameters:
verts - vertices of the face
side - side of the object
id - block id
